author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over 800 volunteers of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) took out a rally from the Parthasarathy Temple in Kollanvilai to Padmanabhapuram Palace in Thuckalay in Kanyakumari district to mark the 153rd and 125th birth anniversaries of Swami Vivekananda and B.R. Ambedkar on Saturday.

The cadres, wearing their traditional uniform (white shirt and khaki shorts), participated in the procession which was regulated by RSS volunteers all along the route. Traffic was diverted from Thuckalay junction on the Thiruvananthapuram highway for about half an hour.

Prasoba Kumar, Divisional Organiser, told The Hindu that the police denied permission for the rally citing law and order problem.

However, this year, the RSS approached the court for taking out the procession. The Madras High Court set aside the conditions imposed by the police.

As per the court order, the RSS rally was allowed with live band.

Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan, RSS South India president Vannniyarajan and State convenor A. Senthil Balaji participated.

RSS divisional president S.R. Srinivasa Kannan led the rally. RSS divisional secretaries T. Ayyappan, Deiva Prakash, BJP State secretary Dharmaraj, district president R. Ganesan, Hindu Munnai district president Misa Soman and BMS State secretary Murugesan participated.

Superintendent of Police G. Dharmarajan, Thuckalay Assistant Superintendent of Police Vikrant Patil monitored the security arrangements. Heavy police force was posted to ensure peaceful conduct of the rally from Kollanvilai to Padmanabhapuram Palace.
title: RSS volunteers take out rally
